cards.name: Restless Dead
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Restless Dead.
cards.flavor:
The rich's heirs often thank them after death . . . but preferably not in person.
—Suq'Ata epigram
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate

cards.name: Sewer Rats
cards.text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.
cards.flavor:
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away.
—Suq'Ata insult
cards.originalText: {B}, Pay 1 life: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {B}{B}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Shadow Guildmage
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
{R}, {T}: Shadow Guildmage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
To keep the dead so others may live.
—Shadow Guild maxim
cards.originalText:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of owner's library.
{R}, {T}: Shadow Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Shallow Grave
cards.text: Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Good help is hard to dig up.

rulings.text: Only exiles the creature if the creature is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.

cards.originalText: Put the top creature card from your graveyard into play as though it were just played. That creature is unaffected by summoning sickness. Remove the creature from the game at end of any turn.

cards.name: Shauku, Endbringer
cards.text:
Flying
Shauku, Endbringer can't attack if there's another creature on the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 3 life.
{T}: Exile target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Shauku.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Shauku, Endbringer cannot attack if there is another creature in play.
During your upkeep, lose 3 life.
{T}: Remove target creature from the game and put a +1/+1 counter on Shauku.

cards.name: Skulking Ghost
cards.text:
Flying
When Skulking Ghost becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor:
"They exist only so long as the living take no notice."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

rulings.text: You'll sacrifice this creature even if you counter the spell or ability that targets it. If that spell has no other targets, it'll be countered when it tries to resolve.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Skulking Ghost is the target of a spell or effect, bury Skulking Ghost.

cards.name: Soul Rend
cards.text:
Destroy target creature if it's white. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Since I cannot stop death, I choose to stop life."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: Only checks the color of the creature on resolution.

cards.originalText:
Bury target creature if it is white.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Soulshriek
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"The flesh is a casket for the soul."
—Shauku, Endbringer
cards.originalText: Target creature you control gets +*/+0 until end of turn, where * is equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard. Bury that creature at end of turn.

cards.name: Spirit of the Night
cards.text:
Flying, trample, haste, protection from black
Spirit of the Night has first strike as long as it's attacking.
cards.originalText:
Flying, trample, protection from black
First strike when attacking
Spirit of the Night is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Stupor
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
cards.flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.originalText: Target opponent discards a card at random, then chooses and discards a card.

cards.name: Tainted Specter
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card unless they put a card from their hand on top of their library. If that player discards a card this way, Tainted Specter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: Tainted Specter used to have errata causing the card to be put into the graveyard without being discarded. The current wording returns it to being a discard, so it will trigger abilities appropriately.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Target player chooses a card from his or her hand and then chooses either to discard that card or put it on top of his or her library. If the card is discarded, Tainted Specter deals 1 damage to each creature and player. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Tombstone Stairwell
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if Tombstone Stairwell is on the battlefield, each player creates a 2/2 black Zombie creature token with haste named Tombspawn for each creature card in their graveyard.
At the beginning of each end step or when Tombstone Stairwell leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens created with Tombstone Stairwell. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: All the tokens are put onto the battlefield simultaneously.
Both the cumulative upkeep and the triggered ability trigger at the beginning of upkeep, so you can choose what order they resolve.
You control the triggered ability, but each player controls the token creature they put onto the battlefield due to the ability's effect.
Does not put the Zombies onto the battlefield if this card is not still on the battlefield when its ability resolves.
If something changes the names of the tokens, then the "at end of turn" ability will still destroy them.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{B} 
During each upkeep, each player puts into play a Tombspawn token for each summon card in his or her graveyard. Treat these tokens as 2/2 black creatures that are unaffected by summoning sickness and count as Zombies. At end of any turn or if Tombstone Stairwell leaves play, bury all of these tokens.

cards.name: Urborg Panther
cards.text:
{B}, Sacrifice Urborg Panther: Destroy target creature blocking Urborg Panther.
Sacrifice a creature named Feral Shadow, a creature named Breathstealer, and Urborg Panther: Search your library for a card named Spirit of the Night and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
{B}, Sacrifice Urborg Panther: Destroy target creature blocking Urborg Panther.
Sacrifice Feral Shadow, Breathstealer, and Urborg Panther: Search your library for Spirit of the Night and put it into play as though it were just played. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Wall of Corpses
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}, Sacrifice Wall of Corpses: Destroy target creature Wall of Corpses is blocking.
cards.flavor:
"I shall make walls of their flesh, and their blood will be my mortar."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice Wall of Corpses: Destroy target creature blocked by Wall of Corpses.

cards.name: Withering Boon
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay 3 life.
Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor:
"Life for life: this is the immutable law."
—Panya, Granger Guildmage

rulings.text: The payment of 3 life is an additional cost of casting the spell.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Pay 3 life: Counter target summon spell.

cards.name: Zombie Mob
cards.text:
Zombie Mob enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
When Zombie Mob enters the battlefield, exile all creature cards from your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Zombie Mob comes into play with one +1/+1 counter for each summon card in your graveyard. Remove all of those summon cards from the game.

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Even the ancient storytellers proclaimed Zhalfir to be dominant over all Jamuraa. Kaervek's invasion shocked us all."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

rulings.text: If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
This is not considered a draw or a discard.

cards.originalText: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of those cards into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Azimaet Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Azimaet Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"A vizier's dish, best served drenched in honey and almonds."
—Suq'Ata royal recipe
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {U} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Bay Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
"Wear the falcon's feathers in your hair—
be fast as the falcon, bright as the Sun."
—"Rise on Wings," Zhalfirin song
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Bay Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Bazaar of Wonders
cards.text:
When Bazaar of Wonders enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all graveyards.
Whenever a player casts a spell, counter it if a card with the same name is in a graveyard or a nontoken permanent with the same name is on the battlefield.

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
When Bazaar of Wonders comes into play, remove all cards in all graveyards from the game.
Whenever a spell is played, counter it if a card with the same name is in play or in any graveyard.

cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to owner's hand.

cards.name: Cerulean Wyvern
cards.text: Flying, protection from green
cards.flavor:
"Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind!"
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from green

cards.name: Cloak of Invisibility
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has phasing and can't be blocked except by Walls. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"Useful . . . if you can find it."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains phasing and cannot be blocked except by Walls.

cards.name: Coral Fighters
cards.text: Whenever Coral Fighters attacks and isn't blocked, look at the top card of defending player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Coral Fighters attacks and is not blocked, look at the top card of defending player's library. You may choose to put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Dissipate
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"If you weren't born with it, you don't need it."
—Grahilah, former trader of Amiqat

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Remove that spell card from the game.

cards.name: Dream Cache
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage
cards.originalText: Draw three cards. Choose two cards from your hand and put both on either the top or the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Dream Fighter
cards.text: Whenever Dream Fighter blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Dream Fighter and that creature phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.flavor: Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.

rulings.text: Dream Fighter affects all creatures that end up blocking it, including ones that are members of bands.

If Dream Fighter is assigned to block a creature with Flanking, the Flanking ability and the Dream Fighter ability both trigger. The active player's Flanking effect is put on the stack first and resolves after the Dream Fighter's phasing out effect happen, so the Flanking does nothing.

cards.originalText: Whenever Dream Fighter blocks or is blocked by a creature, Dream Fighter and that creature phase out.

cards.name: Energy Vortex
cards.text:
As Energy Vortex enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all vortex counters from Energy Vortex.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Energy Vortex deals 3 damage to that player unless they pay {1} for each vortex counter on Energy Vortex.
{X}: Put X vortex counters on Energy Vortex. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Does a flat 3 damage, not 3 damage per counter.

cards.originalText:
When you play Energy Vortex, choose target opponent.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all energy counters from Energy Vortex.
During chosen opponent's upkeep, he or she pays {1} for each energy counter on Energy Vortex, or it deals 3 damage to him or her.
{X}: Put X energy counters on Energy Vortex. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Ether Well
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. If that creature is red, you may put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.
cards.flavor: "Whoa—my tail will never fit through that hole!"

rulings.text: The choice of where to put the creature is made on resolution.

cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of owner's library. If that creature is red, you may choose to put it on the bottom of owner's library instead.

cards.name: Flash
cards.text: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.

rulings.text: If the creature has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
Only the generic mana in that creature's mana cost is reduced. For example, if that creature's mana cost is {1}{R}, you'll have to pay {R} to keep it.
The creature enters the battlefield, so it will trigger enters-the-battlefield abilities even if you choose not to pay.

If you choose not to pay, the creature is sacrificed immediately. No player will get priority in between the creature entering the battlefield and being sacrificed. Sacrificing the creature this way will trigger any abilities that trigger when it leaves the battlefield, and those abilities will be put onto the stack at the same time as those that triggered when it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Choose a creature card from your hand and put that creature into play as though it were just played. Pay the creature's casting cost reduced by up to {2}. If you cannot, bury the creature.

cards.name: Floodgate
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Floodgate has flying, sacrifice it.
When Floodgate leaves the battlefield, it deals damage equal to half the number of Islands you control, rounded down, to each nonblue creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Quick, Rhirhok—teach me to swim!"
—Makht, goblin casualty
cards.originalText:
If Floodgate gains flying, bury it.
If Floodgate leaves play, it deals to each nonblue creature without flying 1 damage for each two islands you control.

cards.name: Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.text:
Flying
{U}{U}: Return target Aura card from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to Hakim, Loreweaver. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if Hakim isn't enchanted.
{U}{U}, {T}: Destroy all Auras attached to Hakim.

rulings.text: You only check if he has no Auras when activating the ability. You can use the ability multiple times in response to each other to get multiple Auras on him this way.
If you pick an Aura that can't legally enchant this card, then the Aura stays in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}{U}: Put target creature enchantment card from your graveyard on Hakim, Loreweaver. Treat that enchantment as though it were just played. Use this ability only during your upkeep and only if there are no enchantments on Hakim.
{U}{U}, {T}: Destroy all enchantments on Hakim.

cards.name: Harmattan Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face."
—Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Jolt
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"There's nothing like a sudden shock to clarify one's thoughts."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
cards.originalText:
Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Kukemssa Pirates
cards.text: Whenever Kukemssa Pirates attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target artifact defending player controls. If you do, Kukemssa Pirates assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor:
". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Kukemssa Pirates attacks and is not blocked, you may choose to have it deal no damage to defending player this turn. If you do, gain control of target artifact that player controls.

cards.name: Kukemssa Serpent
cards.text:
Kukemssa Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land an opponent controls becomes an Island until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Kukemssa Serpent.
cards.originalText:
Islandhome (If defending player controls no islands, this creature cannot attack. If you control no islands, bury this creature.)
{U}, Sacrifice an island: Target land an opponent controls is an island until end of turn.

cards.name: Meddle
cards.text: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.
cards.flavor:
"Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: Only works on spells with a single target, where that target is a creature. Will not work on spells that target a single creature and a player, for example.

cards.originalText: Target spell, which targets a single creature, targets another creature of your choice instead. The new target must be legal.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew."
—Azeworai, "Three Riddles"

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Put that spell on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Merfolk Raiders
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"Turn your back for a second and they just vanish! As if they weren't shifty enough before."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer
cards.originalText: Phasing; islandwalk (If defending player controls any islands, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Merfolk Seer
cards.text: When Merfolk Seer dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
The sea leaves no room for tears.
—Zhalfirin adage
cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Draw a card. Use this ability only when Merfolk Seer is put into the graveyard from play and only once.

cards.name: Mind Bend
cards.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word or basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonred creature" to "nongreen creature" or "plainswalk" to "swampwalk.")

cards.name: Mind Harness
cards.text:
Enchant red or green creature
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

cards.name: Mist Dragon
cards.text:
{0}: Mist Dragon gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{0}: Mist Dragon loses flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}{U}: Mist Dragon phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth."
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.originalText:
{0}: Flying
{0}: Loses flying
{3}{U}{U}: Phases out

cards.name: Mystical Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"To the tutors, a 'poem of sand' was of little account, a 'poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for an instant, interrupt, mana source, or sorcery card and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your library and put the revealed card back on top of it.

cards.name: Political Trickery
cards.text: Exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"Politics is a game—move a stone here, move a stone there—except sometimes the stones bleed."
—Shauku, Endbringer
cards.originalText: Choose target land you control and target land an opponent controls. Exchange control of those lands.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.
cards.flavor: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"

rulings.text: If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. Nothing else happens.
If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.
If the targeted creature has indestructible, it's still a legal target — it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.

cards.originalText: Bury target creature. That creature's controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until a creature card is revealed and then puts that creature into play under his or her control as though it were just played. The player shuffles all other revealed cards into his or her library.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless that spell's caster pays an additional {X}. That player draws and pays all mana from lands and mana pool until {X} is paid; he or she may also draw and pay mana from other sources if desired.

cards.name: Prismatic Lace
cards.text: Target permanent becomes the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: Target permanent becomes the color(s) of your choice. Costs to tap, maintain, or use an ability of that permanent remain unchanged.

cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
cards.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.originalText: Compare your life total with target player's life total. If the difference is 5 or less and you have at least 1 life, exchange life totals with that player.

cards.name: Ray of Command
cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
cards.flavor: "Heel."

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason — because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn. Tap the creature if you lose control of it at end of this turn.

cards.name: Reality Ripple
cards.text: Target artifact, creature, or land phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Can you prepare for the unexpected? No, you cannot. You can prepare only to be surprised."
—Teferi
cards.originalText: Target artifact, creature, or land phases out.

cards.name: Sandbar Crocodile
cards.text: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"We've run aground sandbars before, but today, a sandbar ran aground us."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate
cards.originalText: Phasing

cards.name: Sapphire Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
• Target creature an opponent controls phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
cards.originalText: Choose one Target player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep; or target creature an opponent controls phases out; or target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Sea Scryer
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source. {1}, {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Shaper Guildmage
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Shape this world in Zhalfir's image.
—Shaper Guild maxim
cards.originalText:
{W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shimmer
cards.text:
As Shimmer enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
Each land of the chosen type has phasing. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
To buy unseen land, pay in unseen coin.
—Suq'Ata maxim

rulings.text: Can affect basic or non-basic types, but it must be for a specific type. The chosen type must be an existing land type. See the glossary of the comprehensive rulebook for more details on existing land types.

cards.originalText:
When you play Shimmer, choose a land type.
All lands of the chosen type gain phasing.

cards.name: Soar
cards.text:
You may cast Soar as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 and has flying.
cards.flavor:
"Would you give up your hands to fly? That is what the birds have done."
—The One Thousand Questions

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Soar as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 and gains flying.

cards.name: Suq'Ata Firewalker
cards.text:
Suq'Ata Firewalker can't be the target of red spells or abilities from red sources.
{T}: Suq'Ata Firewalker deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Comfortable even in a furnace? I've never met one who'd accept my wager."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText:
Suq'Ata Firewalker cannot be the target of red spells or effects.
{T}: Suq'Ata Firewalker deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Taniwha
cards.text:
Trample
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, all lands you control phase out. (They phase in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"Taniwha rolls in its sleep, and the land is awash with the waves."
—Poetics of Hanan
cards.originalText:
Phasing, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, all lands you control phase out.

cards.name: Teferi's Curse
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent has phasing. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of their untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"Stepping through time is like riding a camel. It may get you where you want to go, but the ride is rarely pleasant."
—Teferi
cards.originalText:
Play only on an artifact or creature.
Enchanted permanent gains phasing.

cards.name: Teferi's Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
cards.flavor:
"We threw dried fruit to the drakes that rode the air, streaming along the Weatherlight's side as we sailed amidst the clouds."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Flying, phasing

cards.name: Teferi's Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Teferi's Imp phases out, discard a card.
Whenever Teferi's Imp phases in, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Made you look.

rulings.text: There is no negative effect if you can't discard when it phases out. You still get to draw a card when it phases in.

cards.originalText:
Flying, phasing
When Teferi's Imp phases out, choose and discard a card.
When Teferi's Imp phases in, draw a card.

cards.name: Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Thirst enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Thirst unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: The first of the Thousand Deaths.
cards.originalText:
When Thirst comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
During your upkeep, pay {U} or bury Thirst.
Enchanted creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Tidal Wave
cards.text: Create a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: When mountains ride the sea, waves live upon the fields.
cards.originalText: Put a Wave token into play. Treat this token as a 5/5 blue creature that counts as a Wall. Bury the token at end of any turn.

cards.name: Vaporous Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Vaporous Djinn phases out unless you pay {U}{U}. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.flavor:
"What is taking them so long to fill the waterskins?"
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd
cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, pay {U}{U} or Vaporous Djinn phases out.

cards.name: Wave Elemental
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Wave Elemental: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Consider the wave: how weak the mother yet how strong the child."
—Tywanna, Shaper Guildmage
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Wave Elemental: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.

cards.name: Afiya Grove
cards.text:
Afiya Grove enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, move a +1/+1 counter from Afiya Grove onto target creature.
When Afiya Grove has no +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice it.

rulings.text: If there are any creatures on the battlefield, even if they are just your opponent's, you must put a +1/+1 on one of them. If there are no creatures on the battlefield, then no counter is removed from this card.

cards.originalText:
Afiya Grove comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, put one of these counters on target creature.
If Afiya Grove has none of these counters on it, bury it.

cards.name: Armor of Thorns
cards.text:
You may cast Armor of Thorns as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant nonblack creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Armor of Thorns as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Play only on a nonblack creature.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Barbed Foliage
cards.text:
Whenever a creature attacks you, it loses flanking until end of turn.
Whenever a creature without flying attacks you, Barbed Foliage deals 1 damage to it.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature attacks you, it loses flanking until end of turn.
Whenever a creature without flying attacks you, Barbed Foliage deals 1 damage to it.

cards.name: Brushwagg
cards.text: Whenever Brushwagg blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Defiantly, the young cyclops popped the brushwagg into his mouth. His cheeks suddenly puffed, his eye bulged, and he was forced to agree with his elder."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: If Brushwagg blocks or is blocked, it gets -2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Canopy Dragon
cards.text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Canopy Dragon gains flying and loses trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In the Mwonvuli you must divide your attention between what hangs overhead and what lies underfoot."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText:
Trample
{1}{G}: Flying and loses trample until end of turn

cards.name: Crash of Rhinos
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Cycle of Life
cards.text: Return Cycle of Life to its owner's hand: Target creature you cast this turn has base power and toughness 0/1 until your next upkeep. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor: Thus does nature assert herself.

rulings.text: This does not work on creatures which are put onto the battlefield by an effect instead of by being cast.

cards.originalText: Return Cycle of Life to owner's hand: Target creature you summoned this turn is 0/1 until the beginning of your next upkeep. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Decomposition
cards.text:
Enchant black creature
Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless they pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses 2 life.

rulings.text: If a permanent has multiple instances of cumulative upkeep, each triggers separately. However, the age counters are not connected to any particular ability; each cumulative upkeep ability will count the total number of age counters on the permanent at the time that ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Play only on a black creature.
Enchanted creature gains "Cumulative upkeep—1 life."
If enchanted creature is put into the graveyard, its controller loses 2 life.

cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
cards.flavor:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Fallow Earth
cards.text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Put target land on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course: they have no faith to guide their darts."
—Nuru, Femeref archer
cards.originalText: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"More armies have been lost in the confusion of the jungle mists than to any battle."
—Jolrael
cards.originalText: Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Foratog
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.
cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice a forest: +2/+2 until end of turn

cards.name: Giant Mantis
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"I hate insects of every sort. The only mercy is that they are generally small."
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd
cards.originalText: Giant Mantis can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Gibbering Hyenas
cards.text: Gibbering Hyenas can't block black creatures.
cards.flavor:
Hyenas laughing—what's the joke?
—Femeref phrase meaning
"that's not funny"
cards.originalText: Gibbering Hyenas cannot block black creatures.

cards.name: Granger Guildmage
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Granger Guildmage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
{W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Leave no mouth agape, no stomach unfilled.
—Granger Guild maxim
cards.originalText:
{W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{R}, {T}: Granger Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Hall of Gemstone
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a color. Until end of turn, lands tapped for mana produce mana of the chosen color instead of any other color.

rulings.text: Although the color may be altered, any restrictions on the use of the mana are not removed.
Will not affect lands that do not produce mana.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.
Colorless mana added to a player's mana pool isn't affected.

cards.originalText:
During each player's upkeep, that player chooses a color.
Until end of turn, each mana-producing land produces mana of the chosen color instead of its normal color.

cards.name: Jolrael's Centaur
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?"
—Jolrael
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Jolrael's Centaur cannot be the target of spells or effects.

cards.name: Jungle Patrol
cards.text:
{1}{G}, {T}: Create a 0/1 green Wall creature token with defender named Wood.
Sacrifice a token named Wood: Add {R}.
cards.originalText:
{1}{G}, {T}: Put a Wood token into play. Treat this token as a 0/1 green creature that counts as a Wall.
Sacrifice a Wood token: Add {R} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Jungle Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Jungle Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
cards.flavor: Broad as a baobab—and about as smart.
cards.originalText: For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, Jungle Wurm gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Karoo Meerkat
cards.text: Protection from blue
cards.flavor:
"Be like the meerkat, my daughters: ever vigilant, true to your own, and wary of strangers."
—Nabil Alamat, Suq'Ata merchant
cards.originalText: Protection from blue

cards.name: Locust Swarm
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Locust Swarm.
{G}: Untap Locust Swarm. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Better a fierce thunderhead than a sky filled with locusts.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate
{G}: Untap Locust Swarm. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Lure of Prey
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if an opponent cast a creature spell this turn.
You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Does work for artifact creatures cast by your opponent.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText:
Play only if an opponent successfully cast a summon spell this turn.
Put a green summon card from your hand into play as though it were just played.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Maro has power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Mindbender Spores
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Whenever Mindbender Spores blocks a creature, put four fungus counters on that creature. The creature gains "This creature doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a fungus counter on it" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fungus counter from this creature."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Mindbender Spores blocks any creature, put four fungus counters on that creature. During its controller's untap phase, remove a fungus counter from the creature. As long as the creature has any fungus counters on it, it does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Mtenda Lion
cards.text: Whenever Mtenda Lion attacks, defending player may pay {U}. If that player does, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by Mtenda Lion this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The lion drank that lake right up! In thanks, he gave Siti the power to speak with lions and make them leave the goats alone."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: If Mtenda Lion attacks, defending player may pay {U} to have it deal no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Natural Balance
cards.text: Each player who controls six or more lands chooses five lands they control and sacrifices the rest. Each player who controls four or fewer lands may search their library for up to X basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield, where X is five minus the number of lands they control. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.

rulings.text: You are not required to find all the basic lands you are entitled to.

cards.originalText:
Each player controlling six or more lands sacrifices enough lands to reduce his or her land total to five.
Each player controlling four or fewer lands may search his or her library for enough basic land to bring his or her land total to five and put those lands into play. Those players shuffle their libraries afterwards.

cards.name: Nettletooth Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Nettletooth Djinn deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"The few of us who survived were denied entry to our camp for two days—so like the pox were the marks we bore."
—Travelogue of Najat
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, Nettletooth Djinn deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Preferred Selection
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top two cards of your library. You may sacrifice Preferred Selection and pay {2}{G}{G}. If you do, put one of those cards into your hand. If you don't, put one of those cards on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: This is no longer a draw, it's simply putting the card into your hand.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your draw phase, look at the top two cards of your library and choose one. Put that card on the bottom of your library, or sacrifice Preferred Selection and pay {2}{G}{G} to draw the card.

cards.name: Quirion Elves
cards.text:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
When you play Quirion Elves, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I've never heard growth before."
—Gowon, Femeref herder

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play, tapped. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Death is not a debt I am yet willing to pay."
—Purraj of Urborg
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Roots of Life
cards.text:
As Roots of Life enters the battlefield, choose Island or Swamp.
Whenever a land of the chosen type an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: It affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

cards.originalText:
When you play Roots of Life, choose islands or swamps.
Whenever a land of the chosen type that target opponent controls becomes tapped, gain 1 life.
